title: On branch and cut approach for q-Allocation Hub Interdiction Problem
authors: Saikat Mukherjee, Prasanna Ramamoorthy, Navneet Vidyarthi
abstract:
Many industries widely adopted hub networks these days. Managing logistics,
transportation, and distribution requires a delicate balance to ensure seamless
operations within this network. Hub network promotes cost-effective routing
through inter-hub flows. Failure of such hubs may impact the total network with
huge costs. In this paper, we study bilevel $q$-allocation hub interdiction
problem. In previous literature hub interdiction problem was studied with
single and multiple allocation protocols.This problem focus on $q$ allocation
which solves single and multiple allocation problem as special case. We also
show improvements on the branch and cut approach by using cutting planes.Our
experiments based on large instances present the efficiency of the approach to
solve some previously unsolved instances.
